item.title: Roberto Fernández Retamar - Stranger, Stranger Still
item.description: [Extraño, Más Extraño] In the dark I touch America’s scar I lay my burning hand on the volcanic and humid South from where we came bleeding alongside other tears. This severe beauty is the eye of my land, and its shadow of fire shakes me. Stay here, bare, don’t leave. Deserted, drunk I shiver in a strange country, stranger still.

item.title: Ernesto Cardenal - Midnight Office
item.description: [Oficio Nocturno] 2 AM. It is the hour of the Midnight Office, and in shadow the church seems full of demons. This is the hour of darkness and parties. The hour of my binges. And my past returns. “And my sin is always before me” And while we recite the psalms, my memories interfere with prayer like radios and jukeboxes. Old movie scenes come back, nightmares, hours alone in hotels, dances, journeys, kisses, bars.
